data.text: @ZoeJardiniere The article dismisses that leakage on metro heartlands but if it happens in marginals Labour in danger. My point is in my northern marginal that leakage could be important. More, or as, important than trying to win the Brexit voting trad labour voters.
@ZoeJardiniere Im just not sure that's true. The electoral damage to Labour of liberal left leakage to Greens, Liberals or just not voting I think is underestimated.

@paulsrkendal I'm not saying it makes sense morally or economically or anything like that. It's a massive failure of values, courage or common sense. But it makes electoral sense and that's just a fact. That's why they're ignoring the voices of people like me who are anti-Brexit etc.

@ZoeJardiniere No not exceptional at all. Generalisations of geo based attitudes are crude, simplistic and strategically unhelpful. My ukip voting neighbours are never going to vote Corbyn. Ive friends who might stop voting labour. No "maths" make sense not to challenge brexit
@paulsrkendal Sure sure, you're very exceptional and special, but the maths works out that way.

@ZoeJardiniere It's a very flawed analysis, in lots of ways. Not all left leaning, pro immigration remain voters are in cities. I live in a rural Yorkshire target for Labour and my support is hanging by a thread.
